```{r}

### exercise 1
#double (1) and integer (NA+1L) coerced to double and then double and character ("C") coerced to character
typeof(c(1, NA+1L, "C"))
#double and logical coerced to double
typeof(c(1L / 0, NA))
#integer and double coerced to double
typeof(c(1:3, 5))
#integer and  double coerced to double
typeof(c(3L, NaN+1L))
#NA(lack of value) and logical => logical
typeof(c(NA, TRUE))
#integer and logical to integer
typeof(c(1L,T))
#NaN is a double
typeof(c(NaN,"c"))
typeof(c(NaN,1L))

#Inf is a double
typeof(c(Inf,"c"))
typeof(c(Inf,1L))

#NA can be any value
typeof(c(NA,"c"))
typeof(c(NA,1.0))
typeof(c(NA,1L))
typeof(c(NA,T))


#coercion priority: character>double>integer>logic; NaN and Inf are double; NA can be any type.


```
